0: There are at least three different sets of elevators and depending on where your room is located you can easily get lost
My only complaints is the confusing elevator system
The spa facilities was once highly rated
A gentleman who was cleaning the floor noticed our confusion and helped us locate the proper elevator
I walked by a human vomit stain three days in a row in the hallway by my room without it being cleaned up between 769 and 71
The club level amenities are worth the additional fee and gives you a base to gather your bearings before each adventure into the French Quarter
Changing elevators to get to the room was not cool
The restaurant menu is so bad the place was almost always empty when I went to eat there out of necessity otherwise GO SOMEWHERE ELSE
The facilities are old classic but look a bit run down
1: Nice spa facilities but massage was overpriced and not good
Staff is friendly only problem was I left my phone at gym and realized it on elevator when I went back down
Excellent rooms staff courteous and cleanliness throughout facility

Thanks to them we got last minute big shot tickets to Preservation Hall and we were so grateful to not have to wait in the long long lineOur room was on the 8th floor facing Canal which is what we wanted
The rooms and facilities are always clean and accommodating
Finally got new room but no upgrade just close to elevator THANKS
Very nice hotel but it is a Ritz Carlton so I expected five star treatment five star facilities Etc
Overall The Ritz Carlton would be my choice for luxury accommodations in New Orleans and I would gladly go back
The service and accommodations are superb
We had fabulous views from our corner room enjoyed the Club Lounge amenities and will only stay here when we return to NOLA
